results.title: [Eat LOUD carpet compilation]
results.creator_credit: LOUD Media Festival of Youth Culture and the Arts
results.brief_description: A collection of four short films from the SBS program, “Eat Carpet”, in which things aren’t always as they seem. “Goth to be Greek”, directed by Andrew Georgiou and Tim Slade, is the story of a goth who finally finds a woman who wears black and hangs out in cemeteries. “Bad news”, directed by Sofya Gollan, tells the tale of a profoundly deaf couple who react in an unexpected way after hearing some news from their apologetic doctor. “Skater, homie, skeggy, wog”, directed by Andrew Dowell and Brendan Dowell, focuses on some of the myths and misconceptions that teens from rival suburbs have regarding each other’s dress and way of living. “How black is black?”, directed by Jade Woods (aged 13), looks at the identity crises suffered by fair-skinned Koories.

results.title: [Diving]. Thrills on ice. Acrobatic marvels.
results.brief_description: A compilation of three cinemagazine items: 1. [Diving] No title: Diving at outdoor pool near Luna Park, St Kilda and from Prince’s Bridge, Melbourne city. 2. Thrills on ice: Ice skaters in performance at indoor ice rink (St Moritz, St Kilda?). 3. Acrobatic marvels: Demonstration by acrobats in parkland.

2. I didn’t know it was going to be like this
3. What do you want from me

results.title: [Development of the aeroplane: aviation 1915-1940]
results.brief_description: A documentary on the development of experimental and commercial aviation, 1915 to 1945, focusing mainly on the British contribution with recognition given to Lindbergh and Kingsford Smith. Beginning of film missing and title and credits not available.

results.title: [Democracy]
results.creator_credit: Henri Safran, Michael Rubetzki and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This film is aimed at conveying to young people the value and importance of the vote. Actors portray representatives of the community such as: farmers, mechanics, clergymen and teenagers as they pass symbolically through the various evolutionary forms of government, including the monarchical system, military dictatorship, extremism and participatory democracy.

results.title: [Definition of therbligs]
results.brief_description: The fundamental motions of the hands of a worker. These operations are made up of 17 types of motion: search, select, grasp, reach, move, hold, release, position, pre-position, inspect, assemble, disassemble, use, unavoidable delay, avoidable delay, plan, and test to overcome fatigue. Frank Bunker Gilbreth defined these motions in his system of motion study. (Therblig is Gilbreth spelled backwards). This film consists of twenty numbered sequences illustrating each of the therbligs.

results.title: [Conversations on Asian nationalism]
results.brief_description:
A conversation on Asian nationalism with representatives from different countries including Singapore, China and ‘The Age’ newspaper, Melbourne. Topics include ‘modernising nationalism’, the difference between ‘westernisation’ and ‘modernisation’.
Film has no title or credits.

results.title: [Compilation of excerpts from Buster Keaton's short films]
results.creator_credit: Buster Keaton and Buster Keaton Films
results.brief_description:
A compilation of excerpts from some of Buster Keaton’s silent slapstick comedy films.
1. Buster Keaton gets a job in an ice cream parlour.
2. Keaton plays baseball.
3. Keaton plays a ‘colored’ waiter.
4. ‘College’ (part 4) - Keaton tries out in track and field.
5. Keaton joins a rowing club.
6. Keaton shows his guests around his ‘modern’ mansion.
NB: No opening title sequences and shorts are spliced together.
